amendatorysection.para: Reciprocal or interinsurance contracts, the exchange thereof, the subscribers, attorneys in fact, agents, and representatives, and all matters incident to or concerned with such contracts and relationship, shall be exclusively subject to and regulated by the provisions of sections 44-1201 to 44-1214, and no other law relating to insurance heretofore or hereafter enacted, except as provided in this article, or when such other law relating to insurance specifically uses the words reciprocal or interinsurance.

annotation.para: Fraternal benefit insurance organizations are not exempt from law confining all corporations, societies and associations to objects and purposes of existence. Folts v. Globe Life Ins. Co., 117 Neb. 723, 223 N.W. 797 (1929).
